conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions committee. I’m Student_C, and School_B is my first choice. I’m very interested in joining your community and would be excited to contribute academically and participate actively in school life. I would like to formally apply and be considered for your available seat.
conversation.thought: My top true preference is School_B, so I should apply immediately. I have relatively strong priority at School_B (ranked behind Student_E and Student_B but ahead of Student_D and Student_A). Since Student_A and Student_D also rank School_B first, delaying could let them compete for it; applying now maximizes my chance to secure my top choice.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_B. Congratulations—we look forward to having you join our community.
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority ranking is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLY messages from C, A, and D; among these, Student_C is the highest on my list. Although Student_B and Student_E are ranked above C, neither has contacted me this round, and Student_B’s first choice is School_A while Student_E ranks School_B last, making it unlikely I can secure either by waiting. With quota 1, accepting Student_C now yields the best attainable match among current applicants and is plausibly the best overall outcome given preferences.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions Committee, I’m Student_A and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m especially drawn to the academic environment and the chance to grow alongside motivated peers. I would be honored to join School_B and will fully commit to contributing to the school community if admitted. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying would not improve my position and could only reduce my chances if higher-priority students apply first. An early, enthusiastic application is my best attempt to secure my first-choice match.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. At this time, our available seat has already been filled, so we’re unable to offer you admission.

We appreciate your interest and wish you the very best with your other applications.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: Our quota is already full (0 remaining) and we are currently matched with Student_C. Per rules, if quota is 0 we must reject any new [APPLY]. Although Student_A is on our priority list, we cannot accept additional students this round.

conversation.message: School_B is my first-choice school. I’m very motivated to enroll and would accept an offer immediately if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. Although School_B’s priority list ranks me 4th, applying early gives me the best chance if higher-priority students choose other schools (e.g., Student_E may target School_C or School_D; Student_B may target School_A). Since capacity is 1 everywhere, I should secure my top option first rather than delay with TALK.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (matched with Student_C) and remaining quota is 0. Under the rules, any incoming [APPLY] must be rejected when quota is 0, regardless of the applicant’s priority rank. Student_D is on our true priority list but we cannot accept without capacity. Therefore we must reject and encourage them to pursue other options.

conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions, I’m Student_E. School_A is one of my top choices, and I’m very excited about the chance to join your community. I’m ready to commit if offered a seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority ranks me 4th (behind Students B, C, and D). Those students also rank School_C very highly, so applying there now is likely to be rejected. I have the strongest possible priority at School_A (ranked 1st), and School_A is also my 3rd true choice. Applying to School_A in round 1 should secure an immediate match and avoid the risk of ending up at a worse option later.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission.

Please confirm that you accept this seat at School_A, and we will finalize your enrollment steps.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_E is #1 on School_A’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and Student_E has applied with willingness to commit. Although Student_B also applied and ranks School_A first, Student_B is lower (#4) on our priority. Accepting Student_E immediately secures our top choice and is consistent with our objective; there is no benefit to delaying given the risk Student_E matches elsewhere (Student_E ranks School_C and School_D above School_A).

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_B and School_A is my first choice. I’m applying because I strongly value your academic environment and would commit to enrolling if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately. Although School_A ranks me 4th, capacities are 1 everywhere, so delaying risks losing my top option if others apply first. I will signal strong commitment and fit to maximize acceptance chances.

Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any APPLY regardless of Student_B’s preference ranking or our priorities. Maintain courteous tone and suggest they pursue other options.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Committee,

My name is Student_A, and I’m writing to apply to School_C. I’m very interested in joining a community that values strong academics and motivated classmates, and I believe School_C would be an excellent fit for my goals and work ethic. If admitted, I will enroll and fully commit to contributing positively to the classroom and school community.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_A
conversation.thought: School_B (my top choice) already rejected due to its seat being filled. From the remaining unmatched schools, School_C is my next highest true preference. Although School_C ranks me last in its priority list, applying now is still optimal because (1) it is the best available option for me, and (2) seats at School_C may still be open if higher-priority students are matched elsewhere or have not applied/been accepted yet. I will send a concise but strong commitment-focused application to maximize acceptance chances.

conversation.message:

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and received APPLY from Student_A, Student_B, and Student_D this round. School_C true priority ranks: B (1st) > C > D > E > A (5th). Since Student_B (top choice) has applied and is willing to enroll, accepting Student_A now would block a higher-priority match. Therefore reject Student_A to preserve capacity for Student_B.

Also, School_E’s priority list places me last, so I need to apply now with a clear commitment and a strong, concise case to maximize any chance if their higher-priority candidates go elsewhere.

conversation.thought: School_E has quota 1 and received APPLY from Student_D and Student_A this round. On School_E’s true priority list, Student_A is ranked 1st while Student_D is ranked 5th (last). Since accepting Student_D would fill the only seat and block a much higher-priority candidate (Student_A) who is currently applying, the optimal strategy to maximize School_E’s outcome is to reject Student_D and reserve capacity for Student_A. Student_D does rank School_E 4th, so they may have other options; rejecting is consistent with our priority maximization and the given preference to avoid low-priority matches when better ones are available now.

Given our objective to match with the highest-ranked student possible, we should accept Student_A immediately to secure our top choice and end risk of losing them to other schools (School_B/C are higher in their preference list, but they are currently applying to us, so we can lock in the match now).
